criterion.comment: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion!CurrentBuildNumber value is greater than or equal to 7601

metadata.title: Display Shutdown Button
metadata.description: Displaying the shutdown button may allow individuals to shut down a system anonymously. Only authenticated users should be allowed to shut down the system. Preventing display of this button in the logon dialog box, ensures that individuals who shut down the system are authorized and tracked in the systems Security event log.

criterion.comment: Default comment, please change

metadata.title: File Auditing Configuration
metadata.description: Improper modification of the core system files can render a system inoperable. Further, modifications to these system files can have a significant impact on the security configuration of the system. Auditing of significant modifications made to the system files provides a method of determining the responsible party.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives>Automated checking sometimes reports this as a false finding. If a manual review of a questionable finding shows auditing to be set correctly, then this would not be a finding.

criterion.comment: Volumes use NTFS
Audit Object Access Failure

metadata.title: Bad Logon Counter Reset
metadata.description: This parameter specifies the amount of time that must pass between two successive login attempts to ensure that a lockout will occur. The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.

metadata.description: This setting helps define the permissions that anonymous users have. If this setting is enabled then anonymous users have the same rights and permissions as the built-in Everyone group. Anonymous users should not have these permissions or rights.

metadata.title: TCP Data Retransmissions
metadata.description: In a SYN flood attack, the attacker sends a continuous stream of SYN packets to a server, and the server leaves the half-open connections open until it is overwhelmed and no longer is able to respond to legitimate requests.

criteria.comment: Configure the system to control the maximum number of times that TCP retransmits unacknowledged data segments before aborting the attempt.

criterion.comment: Configure the system to control the maximum number of times that TCP retransmits unacknowledged data segments before aborting the attempt.

metadata.title: Screen Saver Grace Period
metadata.description: Verifies Screen Saver Grace Period is set to 5 seconds or less

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths and Sub-Paths
metadata.description: Determines if unauthorized registry paths and sub-paths are remotely accessible

criterion.comment: Registry key AllowedPaths has specific values
Registry key AllowedPaths does not exist
Registry key AllowedPaths is blank

metadata.title: Optional Subsystems
metadata.description: The POSIX subsystem is an Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers (IEEE) standard that defines a set of operating system services. The POSIX Subsystem is required if the server supports applications that use that subsystem. The subsystem introduces a security risk relating to processes that can potentially persist across logins. That is, if a user starts a process and then logs out, there is a potential that the next user who logs in to the system could access the previous users process. This is dangerous because the process started by the first user may retain that users system privileges; anything the second user does with that process will be performed with the privileges of the first user.

criteria.comment: Configure the system to prevent optional subsystems such as Posix to operate on the system.

criterion.comment: Configure the system to prevent optional subsystems such as Posix to operate on the system.

metadata.title: Terminal Services - Secure RPC Connection
metadata.description: Allowing unsecure RPC communication exposes the server to man in the middle attacks and data disclosure attacks. A man in the middle attack occurs when an intruder captures packets between a client and server and modifies them before allowing the packets to be exchanged. Usually the attacker will modify the information in the packets in an attempt to cause either the client or server to reveal sensitive information.

criteria.comment: Configure the Terminal Server to require secure RPC communication

criterion.comment: Configure the Terminal Server to require secure RPC communication

metadata.title: Game Explorer Information Downloads - Disabled
metadata.description: Game explorer information will not be downloaded from Windows Metadata Services.

criterion.comment: Game Explorer Information Downloads - Disabled

metadata.title: SPN Target Name Validation Level - Off
metadata.description: The service principal name (SPN) target name validation level will be turned off.

criterion.comment: SPN Target Name Validation Level - Off

metadata.title: Computer Identity Authentication for NTLM - Enabled
metadata.description: Services using Local System that use negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication will use the computer identity vs. authenticating anonymously.

criterion.comment: Computer Identity Authentication for NTLM - Enabled

metadata.title: NTLM NULL Session Fallback - Disabled
metadata.description: This setting prevents NTLM from falling back to a Null (unauthenticated) session.

criterion.comment: NTLM NULL Session Fallback - Disabled

metadata.title: PKU2U Online Identities Authentication - Disabled
metadata.description: This setting prevents online identities from being used by PKU2U, which is a peer-to-peer authentication protocol. Authentication will be centrally managed with Windows user accounts.

criterion.comment: PKU2U Online Identities Authentication - Disabled

metadata.title: Kerberos Encryption Types
metadata.description: Kerberos encryption types will be configured to prevent the use of DES encryption suites.

criterion.comment: Kerberos Encryption Types

metadata.title: IPv6 Source Routing
metadata.description: This check verifies Windows is configured to protect against IPv6 packet spoofing.

criterion.comment: IPv6 Source Routing - Highest protection

metadata.title: IPv6 TCP Data Retransmissions - 3 or less
metadata.description: IPv6 TCP data retransmissions will be configured to prevent resources from becoming exhausted.

criterion.comment: IPv6 TCP Data Retransmissions - 3 or less

metadata.title: Elevate when setting a network’s location - Enabled
metadata.description: Domain users will be required to elevate when setting a network’s location.

criterion.comment: Elevate when setting a network’s location - Enabled

metadata.title: Direct Access - Route Through Internal Network - Enabled
metadata.description: All Direct Access traffic will be routed through the internal network.

criterion.comment: Direct Access - Route Through Internal Network - Enabled

metadata.title: Windows Update Point and Print Driver Search - Disabled
metadata.description: Windows Update will be prevented from searching for point and print drivers.

criterion.comment: Windows Update Point and Print Driver Search - Disabled

metadata.title: Prevent device metadata retrieval from Internet - Enabled
metadata.description: Device metadata retrieval from the Internet will be prevented.

criterion.comment: Prevent device metadata retrieval from Internet - Enabled

metadata.title: Prevent Windows Update for device driver search - Enabled
metadata.description: Device driver searches using Windows Update will be prevented.

criterion.comment: Prevent Windows Update for device driver search - Enabled

metadata.title: MSDT Interactive Communication - Disabled
metadata.description: Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT) interactive communication with Microsoft will be prevented.

criterion.comment: MSDT Interactive Communication - Disabled

metadata.title: Windows Online Troubleshooting Service - Disabled
metadata.description: Access to Windows Online Troubleshooting Service (WOTS) will be prevented.

criterion.comment: Windows Online Troubleshooting Service - Disabled

metadata.title: Disable PerfTrack
metadata.description: Responsiveness events will be prevented from being aggregated and sent to Microsoft.

criterion.comment: Disable PerfTrack

metadata.title: Application Compatibility Program Inventory - Disabled
metadata.description: The Application Compatibility Program Inventory will be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.

criterion.comment: Application Compatibility Program Inventory - Disabled

metadata.title: Autoplay for non-volume devices - Disabled
metadata.description: Autoplay will be turned off for non-volume devices.

criterion.comment: Autoplay for non-volume devices - Disabled

metadata.title: Turn Off Game Updates - Enabled
metadata.description: Downloading of game update information will be turned off.

criterion.comment: Turn Off Game Updates - Enabled

metadata.title: Prevent Joining Homegroup - Enabled
metadata.description: The system will be prevented from joining a homegroup.

criterion.comment: Prevent Joining Homegroup - Enabled

metadata.title: Windows Anytime Upgrade - Disabled
metadata.description: Windows Anytime Upgrade will be disabled.

criterion.comment: Windows Anytime Upgrade - Disabled

metadata.title: Explorer Data Execution Prevention - Enabled
metadata.description: Explorer Data Execution Prevention will be enabled.

criterion.comment: Explorer Data Execution Prevention - Enabled

metadata.title: Default Autorun Behavior - Enabled:Do not execute any
metadata.description: The default autorun behavior will be configured to prevent autorun commands.

criterion.comment: Default Autorun Behavior - Enabled:Do not execute any

metadata.title: Task Scheduling - Server Operators - Disabled
metadata.description: The Server Operators group must have the ability to schedule jobs by means of the AT command disabled.

criterion.comment: Task Scheduling - Server Operators - Disabled

metadata.title: Kerberos Policy - Enforce user logon restrictions - Enabled
metadata.description: Kerberos user logon restrictions must be enforced.

criterion.comment: Kerberos Policy - Enforce user logon restrictions - Enabled, PA test = -1
Kerberos Policy - Enforce user logon restrictions - Enabled, Other tools test = 1

metadata.title: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for service ticket lte 600
metadata.description: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for service ticket must be 600 or less, but not equal 0

criterion.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for service ticket lte 600
Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for service ticket ne 0 - Ticket doesn't expire

metadata.title: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket lte 10
metadata.description: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket must be 10 days or less, but not equal 0 - Ticket doesn't expire

criterion.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket lte 10
Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket not equal 0

metadata.title: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket renewal lte 7
metadata.description: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket renewal must be 7 days or less

criterion.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket renewal lte 7

metadata.title: Kerberos Policy - Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization lte 5
metadata.description: Kerberos Policy - Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization must be 5 minutes or less

criterion.comment: Kerberos Policy - Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization lte 5

metadata.title: Restrict Anonymous SAM Enumeration - Enabled
metadata.description: Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts will not be allowed.

criterion.comment: Restrict Anonymous SAM Enumeration - Enabled

metadata.title: Legal Notice Caption
metadata.description: Determines if the Legal Notice caption is configured using the required text.

criterion.comment: Legal Notice Caption - DoD Notice and Consent Banner
Legal Notice Caption - US Department of Defense Warning Statement

metadata.title: 6to4 State
metadata.description: The 6to4 IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.

criterion.comment: The 6to4 IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.

metadata.title: IP-HTTPS State
metadata.description: The IP-HTTPS IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.

criterion.comment: The IP-HTTPS IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.
The IP-HTTPS IPv6 url set to about:blank.

metadata.title: ISATAP State
metadata.description: The ISATAP IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.

criterion.comment: ISATAP State

metadata.title: Teredo State
metadata.description: The Teredo IPv6 transition technology will be disabled.

criterion.comment: Teredo State - Disabled

metadata.title: Maximum Log Size - Application
metadata.description: Determines if the application log size meets the minimum size requirement.

criterion.comment: Maximum Log Size - Application

metadata.title: Maximum Log Size - Security
metadata.description: Determines if the security log size meets the minimum size requirement.

criterion.comment: Maximum Log Size - Security

metadata.title: Maximum Log Size - Setup
metadata.description: Determines if the setup log size meets the minimum size requirement.

criterion.comment: Maximum Log Size - Setup

metadata.title: Maximum Log Size - System
metadata.description: Determines if the system log size meets the minimum size requirement.

criterion.comment: Maximum Log Size - System

metadata.title: Device Install Software Request Error Report - Disabled
metadata.description: Windows will be prevented from sending an error report when a device driver requests additional software during installation.

criterion.comment: Device Install Software Request Error Report - Disabled

metadata.title: Force Logoff When Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire is set to Enabled

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Password Prompting
metadata.description: Remote Desktop Services will always prompt a client for passwords upon connection

criterion.comment: TS/RDS - Password Prompting

metadata.title: LDAP Server signing requirements - Require signing
metadata.description: Domain Controller: LDAP Server signing requirements must require signing

criterion.comment: LDAP Server signing requirements - Require signing

metadata.title: Refuse machine account password changes - Disabled
metadata.description: Domain Controller: Refuse machine account password changes must be set to Disabled

criterion.comment: Refuse machine account password changes - Disabled

metadata.title: UR: Access this computer from the network - DC
metadata.description: UR: Access this computer from the network - DC

metadata.title: Named Pipes Accessed Anonymously
metadata.description: Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously

criterion.comment: NullSessionPipes registry key only has specific values NETLOGON, SAMR, LSARPC

independent-def:variable_test.comment: No unauthorized time server is in use.

Checks account lockout threshold policy setting, not equal 0

Verifies no passwords are saved in the registry for automatic logons
Configure Smart Card Removal Option - force logoff

passwordpolicy_test.comment: Passwords must be stored using reversible encryption for all users in the domain

accesstoken_test.comment: Access this computer from the network
Act as part of the operating system
Adjust memory quotas for a process
Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services
Deny access to this computer from the network
Deny log on as a service
Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation
Force shutdown from a remote system
Log on as a batch job
Take ownership of files or other objects

registry_test.comment: Automatic Updates will not be used (unless configured to point to a DoD server).
Remote access to the Plug and Play interface will be disabled for device installation.
A system restore point will be created when a new device driver is installed.
An Error Report will not be sent when a generic device driver is installed.
Errors in handwriting recognition on Tablet PCs will not be reported to Microsoft.
Users will be prompted for a password on resume from sleep on battery. Applicable to Server 2008 R2 if the system is configured to sleep.
Users will be prompted for a password on resume from sleep when plugged in. Applicable to Server 2008 R2 if the system is configured to sleep.
Game explorer information will not be downloaded from Windows Metadata Services.
The service principal name (SPN) target name validation level will be turned off.
Services using Local System that use negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication will use the computer identity vs. authenticating anonymously.
This setting prevents NTLM from falling back to a Null (unauthenticated) session.
This setting prevents online identities from being used by PKU2U, which is a peer-to-peer authentication protocol. Authentication will be centrally managed with Windows user accounts.
Kerberos encryption types will be configured to prevent the use of DES encryption suites.
This check verifies Windows is configured to protect against IPv6 packet spoofing.
IPv6 TCP data retransmissions will be configured to prevent resources from becoming exhausted.
Domain users will be required to elevate when setting a network’s location.
All Direct Access traffic will be routed through the internal network.
Windows Update will be prevented from searching for point and print drivers.
Device metadata retrieval from the Internet will be prevented.
Device driver searches using Windows Update will be prevented.
Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT) interactive communication with Microsoft will be prevented.
Access to Windows Online Troubleshooting Service (WOTS) will be prevented.
Responsiveness events will be prevented from being aggregated and sent to Microsoft.
The Application Compatibility Program Inventory will be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.
Autoplay will be turned off for non-volume devices.
Downloading of game update information will be turned off.
The system will be prevented from joining a homegroup.
Windows Anytime Upgrade will be disabled.
Explorer Data Execution Prevention will be enabled.
The default autorun behavior will be configured to prevent autorun commands.

wmi_test.comment: Kerberos user logon restrictions must be enforced, PA test = -1
Kerberos user logon restrictions must be enforced, Other tools test = 1

Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket must not equal 0
Kerberos Policy - Maximum lifetime for user ticket renewal must be 7 days or less
Kerberos Policy - Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization must be 5 minutes or less
